action: I want to complete the flow of getting applications approved by supervisors on the system
reason: To eliminate paper/oral approvals and achieve business visualization and control
acceptance_criteria: Applications are only executable by authenticated users.
Applicable data types (e.g., expenses, leave, contract applications, etc.) are configurable.
Title, content, and reason for application are mandatory.
Application data must be saved within a transaction.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
The approval flow (approver sequence) is automatically determined at the time of application.
Approval routes can be changed from the management screen.
Approvers are determined based on roles or organizational hierarchy.
Application content is uneditable while in a pending state.
Re-editing by the applicant is only possible during a remand (return).
Approval status must only be Pending / Approved / Rejected / Returned.
Invalid status transitions are not permitted.
Approval operations are only possible for users with approval authority.
Operation logs are stored for approval, rejection, and remand.
Logs include application ID, operating user ID, operation details, and timestamp.
Comment entry is possible during approval.
Comments are mandatory for rejection and remand.
Approval processing is controlled by optimistic locking for concurrency.
In the event of concurrent approval conflicts, subsequent operations must fail.
Approval results are issued as notification events.
Notifications are processed via asynchronous queues.
Full approval history must be maintained.
Change history of application content is maintained.
Approved applications can only be logically deleted.
Approval data is subject to audit logging.
The same validation applies to operations via API.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Unauthorized users cannot view others' applications.
Administrators can view all applications.
Searching and filtering of application data is possible.
Approval deadlines can be set.
Reminder notifications are sent upon deadline expiration.
API responses do not include internal DB structures.
Internal error details are not returned when an error occurs.
Target response time for the approval API is within 500ms.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
